hero.title: Solutions for high-altitude productive and energy settings
hero.desc: We design and deliver food services, infrastructure, and technology-innovation projects tailored to strategic areas of Salta and Northwest Argentina (NOA). We drive local development, energy efficiency, and technical procurement for the business ecosystem.

bullets.quality: Quality and logistics for the business sector

services.title: Services
services.desc: Specialists in high-altitude operations and mining supply chains.
services.s1Desc: End-to-end solutions for logistics, sourcing, and infrastructure across the value chain in high-altitude regions.
services.s2Desc: Renewable energy, telecommunications, and technology initiatives that move the future forward.

values.heading: At SierraDelta Group we work with a clear purpose
values.subheading: to transform territories through sustainable, innovative projects deeply committed to community development. Our identity as a Salta-based company comes through in everything we do across three core pillars:

sustain.title: Local-led development
sustain.desc: We create local jobs and add value at the source, strengthening regional economies while respecting each community’s cultural identity.

quality.title: Sustainability
quality.desc: We design efficient energy solutions for remote settings, prioritizing environmental care, responsible resource use, and growth aligned with territorial regeneration.

innov.title: Innovation
innov.desc: We apply technology, engineering, and creativity to solve energy, logistics, and construction challenges in extreme environments, with industrial solutions tailored to the NOA mining ecosystem.

values.closing: We are SierraDelta Group. We believe a purpose-driven company can be a real engine of transformation for Salta—its people and its future.

hero.title: Food & Production
hero.desc: Two nodes that amplify each other: Casa Díaz crafts zero-mile food in the Calchaquí Valleys, and BACOÑA serves as a logistics hub and dining experience in the Puna. We accelerate local entrepreneurs and prioritize organic raw materials.

steps.title: Commercialization
